results.title: Let them come with rain
results.creator_credit: Martin Bunnel, Bill Brind, George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Botawana, land-locked in southern Africa, is now taking the painful early steps towards modern nationhood. Much of Botswana is the Kalahari Desert, Botswana’s new leaders look to their vast mineral resources from which to gain a key to the industrial future her people want.

results.title: Let the therapy fit the crime
results.creator_credit: Michael Andrews, Brian Gibson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
There is a high proportion of persistent offenders in Britain’s gaols. There are two schools of thought concerning the reasons for criminality. Behaviouralists consider that personality is determined by heredity as well as by environment, while psychoanalysts maintain that a criminal’s aggressive behaviour arises out of internal conflict resulting from traumatic experiences in early life. Both schools of thought believe that remedial treatment and not punishment is the only way to help people.

results.title: Let the balloon go (K)
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Set in a small Australian outback town in 1917, this is the story of a young boy who is determined to fight against the limitations imposed upon him because of his physical disabilities. Based on the novel of the same name by Ivan Southall. Cinematography by Dean Semler.

results.title: Let me out
results.creator_credit: Stuart Griffiths, Gregg Torkington and Kiar Eegan
results.brief_description: A montage of animated images that describe a city without hope filled with loneliness, prostitutes and desperate people. But, is the situation really that bad? Animated and produced by the team: Kiar Eegan, Gregg Torkington and Stuart Griffiths.

results.title: Let me explain...
results.creator_credit: Samantha Van Zanen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Samantha Van Zanen’s story starts with a dramatic childbirth but mostly reflects on the darkest years of her life as she coped with having Turner’s Syndrome. The bullying, needles and anguish were alleviated somewhat by her family and close friends.

results.title: Let me die, again
results.brief_description: A young man dreams of himself as embdying the spirit and the flesh of the great opera diva, Maria Callas. But in the harsh reality of the mirror he has to confront his body, his maleness and the past. A richly stylised tribute to queer’s legacy of fascination and subversion in the romance of opera.

results.title: Let it bee: Concerto in C Minor by Vivaldi
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. A domesticated honey-bee prepares a picnic with wine and cheese but is disturbed by a romancing couple bent also on picnicking. Music from Vivaldi. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Let It Be
results.creator_credit: Neil Aspinall, Michael Lindsay-Hogg and Apple Corps
results.brief_description: Documentary film about The Beatles rehearsing and recording songs for the album Let It Be in January 1969. The film features an unannounced rooftop concert by the group, their last performance in public. Released just after the album, it was the final original Beatles release. This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

results.title: Let hi-speed clean your oven!
results.brief_description: An advertising film presenting Mrs Housewife attempting to remove built up grease from her oven. All her efforts fail until she tries ‘Hi-Speed’ stove cleaner which dissolves baked on grease without damaging the enamel. Provides an insight into mid 20th Century marketing and the representation of women in advertising.
